97f98e5df342.description: Perspectives of a 2x entrepreneur turned VC at @UpfrontVC, the largest and most active early-stage fund in Southern California. Snapchat: msuster
97f98e5df342.name: Both Sides of the Table
97f98e5df342.shortDescription: Perspectives of a 2x entrepreneur turned VC at @UpfrontVC…

paragraphs.text: Actually, winter did come and I have the data that shows it. But the reality is that “global warming” massively blunted the effects of winter and my prognosis for VC fundings of entrepreneurs in 2017–2018 is now very sunny indeed. Unless of course something Trumps our good weather.
paragraphs.name: 89f3

paragraphs.text: Actually, winter did come and I have the data that shows it. But the reality is that “global warming” massively blunted the effects of winter and my prognosis for VC fundings of entrepreneurs in 2017–2018 is now very sunny indeed. Unless of course something Trumps our good weather.
paragraphs.name: 89f3

paragraphs.text: But while funding for VCs and funding for tech startups should remain robust, funding is not the same thing as returns. And if the industry becomes over-funded I suspect it will lead to bad behavior at startups, bad behavior at VCs and thus overall depressed returns relative to smaller funding cycles. But this is normal business known as an “economic cycle.”
paragraphs.name: 7a69

paragraphs.text: It was only a year ago that many in the Venture Capital industry were predicting that “winter was coming” and to be fair the author of this post was chief amongst them. Yet as we enter February 2017 the VC funding markets are booming, Snap, Inc has filed for its IPO, AppDynamics was just purchased for $3.7 billion by Cisco and the only winter that can be found is at the ski resorts following California’s epic snowy and rainy January.
paragraphs.name: d186

3fcaa3800b2e.title: traditionally the VC industry has behaved (when I learnt this fact, this led me to understand why…

paragraphs.text: traditionally the VC industry has behaved (when I learnt this fact, this led me to understand why counterintuitive was a word so used in Startup ecosystems) that when lots of money flowed in returns were terrible for even a decade. that led to money running away and equilibrium and good returns.

paragraphs.text: Mark and Chang XU — this analysis has some great insights. Makes me wonder if the US investment scene is transforming and leaping ahead of the rest of the world again. 604b8fc76b56.title: Great overview, thank you for sharing.

paragraphs.text: Great overview, thank you for sharing. I’m quite suprised no real discussion of S&P performance. The VC market froze in response to S&P having a horrible start to 2016 and had the S&P continued to drift down it’s hard to imagine the VC market wouldn’t have had a prolonged “Winter” in such scenario. To a lot of people it might seem as though VC GPs…
Awesome analysis and data, Mark.

8f3d657df681.title: Hey Mark can you point me to that Cambridge Associates study on VC returns?

paragraphs.text: Hey Mark can you point me to that Cambridge Associates study on VC returns? I’ve been asked a lot about the performance of the Venture industry on the returns side and would love to see the most current data set.
